subject: New FAQ entry (Re: [junit] Re: How to change dynamically (runtime) the classpath for a given test)
msgSnippet: ... It occurs to me that this might be a good FAQ entry under the question Why doesn t JUnit support feature X? Does anyone maintain the FAQ any more? -- J.
messageBody:
J. B. Rainsberger wrote:

> David wrote:
>
> > Yes, it is true, but it is a hard assumption, because you need a
> > third library to get this behavior. A testing framework should
> > provide this case, without using another one library.
>
> Now you're making the hard assumption: that what you're doing is
> commonly needed. A framework of any kind should solve common problems
> and leave unusual ones to extensions. This is the difference between
> "framework" and "platform".
>
> http://tinyurl.com/2blcuz <http://tinyurl.com/2blcuz>

It occurs to me that this might be a good FAQ entry under the question
"Why doesn't JUnit support feature X?" Does anyone maintain the FAQ any
more?
--
